measure.name: apply_upgrade
measure.description: Measure that applies an upgrade (one or more child measures) to a building model based on the specified logic.
measure.modeler_description: Determines if the upgrade should apply to a given building model. If so, calls one or more child measures with the appropriate arguments.

argument.name: upgrade_name
argument.description: User-specificed name that describes the upgrade.

argument.name: option_1
argument.description: Specify the parameter|option as found in resources\options_lookup.tsv.

argument.name: option_1_apply_logic
argument.description: Logic that specifies if the Option 1 upgrade will apply based on the existing building's options. Specify one or more parameter|option as found in resources\options_lookup.tsv. When multiple are included, they must be separated by '||' for OR and '&&' for AND, and using parentheses as appropriate. Prefix an option with '!' for not.

argument.name: option_1_cost_1_value
argument.description: Total option 1 cost is the sum of all: (Cost N Value) x (Cost N Multiplier).

argument.name: option_1_cost_1_multiplier
argument.description: Total option 1 cost is the sum of all: (Cost N Value) x (Cost N Multiplier).

argument.name: option_1_cost_2_value
argument.description: Total option 1 cost is the sum of all: (Cost N Value) x (Cost N Multiplier).

argument.name: option_1_cost_2_multiplier
argument.description: Total option 1 cost is the sum of all: (Cost N Value) x (Cost N Multiplier).

argument.name: option_1_lifetime
argument.description: The option lifetime.

argument.name: package_apply_logic
argument.description: Logic that specifies if the entire package upgrade (all options) will apply based on the existing building's options. Specify one or more parameter|option as found in resources\options_lookup.tsv. When multiple are included, they must be separated by '||' for OR and '&&' for AND, and using parentheses as appropriate. Prefix an option with '!' for not.

argument.name: run_measure
argument.description: integer argument to run measure [1 is run, 0 is no run]
